creator: taylor.mathewson@gmail.com
text:
If you run an XPath Extractor post processor against, for example, an XHTML document, the extractor will attempt to retrieve the doc DTD.

Not sure why, XPath Extractor shouldn't really imply document validation, just well-formedness.  I suggest the xml parser havve this disabled for this component.

As an additional enhancement, consider adding it as an option, defaulted to false.

Thanks.

creator: taylor.mathewson@gmail.com
text: As an additional point, this makes it difficult to test if w3c.org goes down, for example.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
This is a feature of the parser used to generate the document. The DTD may contain entitiy definitions etc. that are required to process the document fully.

It is possible to disable DTD resolution, and hopefully this will be in the next release of JMeter.

This has been fixed in SVN:

URL: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=789187&view=rev
Log:
Bug 47338 - XPath Extractor forces retrieval of document DTD
creator: sebb@apache.org
